Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
If the number of items in a model (assigned to a TableViewer) is decreased, the refresh doesn't work correct.

When calling refresh the first time after changing the model, the record is not visually removed from the table. After calling refresh a second time, an assert exception is thrown:

org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: null argument;
	at org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:122)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.disassociate(StructuredViewer.java:563)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefreshAll(TableViewer.java:884)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefresh(TableViewer.java:799)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefresh(TableViewer.java:783)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer$3.run(StructuredViewer.java:1328)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1268)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1325)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1287)

There has been done much work in CVS regarding Table and TableViewer. Also the move to JFace 3.3 had many improvements. But I'll leave this bug open because there are other problems with removing items in the new version because the table widget does not support removing items expect removeAll().

Problem in current CVS: most of the remove methods are not yet implemented in the Table (see bug 187777).
As soon as that bug is fixed, I'll update the TableViewer to work correctly with removed items in the model.
This is fixed in CVS HEAD.

With newest CVS-HEAD (from today) the following exception ocurrs:

java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.doSelect(TableViewer.java:283)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTableViewer.setSelectionToWidget(AbstractTableViewer.java:889)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setSelectionToWidget(StructuredViewer.java:1685)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1377)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1332)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1433)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ColumnViewer.refresh(ColumnViewer.java:493)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1392)

The UnsupportedOperationException is thrown if we don't have the functionality of some widgets at the moment. In this case: Table#select(int[]). I fixed this in CVS and the TableViewer should work as expected without preserving the selection. Could you please confirm this?

No news is good news;)
Closing this bug for now, feel free to re-open if you still experience problems.
